questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is a characteristic property of Erdös –Rényi random networks?
question_texts: Which of the following is a characteristic property of Erdös –Rényi random networks?

options.option_text: Scale-free degree distribution.
Small-world phenomenon.
Uniform probability of edges between nodes.
Hierarchical modular structure.

questions.question_text_1: Assertion: RNA polymerase II is responsible for transcribing protein-coding genes in eukaryotic cells. Reason: RNA polymerase II recognizes and binds to the promoter regions of protein-coding genes, initiating the transcription process.
question_texts: Assertion: RNA polymerase II is responsible for transcribing protein-coding genes in eukaryotic cells. Reason: RNA polymerase II recognizes and binds to the promoter regions of protein-coding genes, initiating the transcription process.

options.option_text: Both the assertion and reason are correct, and the reason is a correctexplanation of the assertion.
Both the assertion and reason are correct, but the reason is not a correctexplanation of the assertion.
The assertion is correct, but the reason is incorrect.
The assertion is incorrect, but the reason is correct.

questions.question_text_1: Choose the TRUE statement
question_texts: Choose the TRUE statement

options.option_text: A smaller characteristic path length indicates a network is tightly connected.
In an Erdös–Rényi G(n ,p) network, there are hub nodes to which new nodesconnect with higher probability, as the network grows.
The degree distribution of Erdös–Rényi G(n ,p) network follows the Poissondistribution, for large n
In a hypergraph, every hyper-edge is a subset of V × V where V is the set of allvertices in the graph.

The diameter of the network increases.

questions.question_text_1: What is the role of topoisomerase in DNA replication
question_texts: What is the role of topoisomerase in DNA replication

options.option_text: Synthesis of a new DNA strand from 5’->3’ using the parental strand as atemplate.
Relieving of DNA supercoiling by formed dues to unwinding of the twostrands.
Prevents annealing of the parental strands.
None of these.

questions.question_text_1: GWAS is used for  A. It aims to find a relation between genotype and phenotype by studying the gene products affecting the phenotype. B. Identifying the association between genotype and phenotype by comparing statistically significant genetic variants of individuals in a population.
question_texts: GWAS is used for  A. It aims to find a relation between genotype and phenotype by studying the gene products affecting the phenotype. B. Identifying the association between genotype and phenotype by comparing statistically significant genetic variants of individuals in a population.

options.option_text: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
None of these.

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary focus of transcriptomics?
question_texts: What is the primary focus of transcriptomics?

options.option_text: Study of protein structures.
Examination of DNA sequences.
Analysis of gene expression at the RNA level.
Investigation of cell morphology.

questions.question_text_1: What is the primary advantage of Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) over traditional Sanger sequencing?
question_texts: What is the primary advantage of Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS) over traditional Sanger sequencing?

options.option_text: Longer read lengths.
Higher accuracy.
Higher throughput.
Lower cost per base.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is/are correct regarding DNA replication
question_texts: Which of the following is/are correct regarding DNA replication

options.option_text: DNA Replication occurs from 5’-> 3’ end.
The leading strand is synthesised in a continuous manner.
DNA polymerase cannot initiate DNA replication.
The lagging strand is synthesised in a continuous manner.

question_texts: Which of the following is/are true regarding RNA

tRNA is translated to protein

questions.question_text_1: Select the correct statements about stop codons.
question_texts: Select the correct statements about stop codons.

options.option_text: Stop codons signal the beginning of translation.
There are three different stop codons in the standard genetic code.
Stop codons do not specify any amino acid.
Mutations converting a stop codon into a start codon can result in normalprotein synthesis.

questions.question_text_1: Application of genomics include
question_texts: Application of genomics include

options.option_text: Studying evolutionary patterns across different strains and species.
Identifying the gene expression patterns in cells.
Studying post translational modifications.
Identify genetic associations to phenotypic traits.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements accurately describe the goals of the 1000 Genomes Project?
question_texts: Which of the following statements accurately describe the goals of the 1000 Genomes Project?

options.option_text: To study the gene expression patterns amongst different individuals
To catalogue the genetic variations in human populations from different ethnicgroups.
To identify common and rare variants that affect various phenotypes in humangenome.
To provide a comprehensive resource for understanding human geneticdiversity
